name: Palantir
explanation: Palantir is a seeing-stone used by Sauron and others in Middle-earth, and also a US data analytics company founded in 2003.

name: Mithril
explanation: Mithril is the precious silver metal in Middle-earth, and also Meta's open-source AI model series.

name: Shadowfax
explanation: Shadowfax is the lord of all horses in Middle-earth, ridden by Gandalf.

name: Zoloft
explanation: Zoloft (sertraline) is one of the most commonly prescribed SSRI antidepressants.

name: Lexapro
explanation: Lexapro (escitalopram) is an SSRI antidepressant used for anxiety and depression.

name: Snorlax
explanation: Snorlax is a Normal-type Pokémon known for sleeping and blocking paths.

name: Celebi
explanation: Celebi is a Psychic/Grass-type mythical Pokémon that can travel through time.

name: Anduril
explanation: Andúril is Aragorn's reforged sword 'Flame of the West', and also a US defense technology company founded by Palmer Luckey.

name: Silmaril
explanation: The Silmarils are three jewels created by Fëanor containing the light of the Two Trees of Valinor.

name: Prozac
explanation: Prozac (fluoxetine) was the first SSRI antidepressant, approved in 1987.

name: Geodude
explanation: Geodude is a Rock/Ground-type Pokémon that looks like a boulder with arms.

name: Arwen
explanation: Arwen Undómiel is the Elven princess who chose mortality to be with Aragorn.

name: Kafka
explanation: Apache Kafka is a distributed event streaming platform used for high-performance data pipelines.

name: Eevee
explanation: Eevee is a Normal-type Pokémon famous for its many possible evolutions.

name: Wellbutrin
explanation: Wellbutrin (bupropion) is an atypical antidepressant that works differently from SSRIs.

name: Terraform
explanation: Terraform is an infrastructure-as-code tool by HashiCorp for provisioning cloud resources.

name: Galadriel
explanation: Galadriel is the Lady of Lothlórien, one of the most powerful Elves in Middle-earth.

name: Cymbalta
explanation: Cymbalta (duloxetine) is an SNRI antidepressant also used for chronic pain.

name: Kubernetes
explanation: Kubernetes (K8s) is an open-source container orchestration platform originally developed by Google.

name: Pikachu
explanation: Pikachu is the iconic Electric-type Pokémon and mascot of the franchise.

name: Númenor
explanation: Númenor was the great island kingdom of Men, destroyed when they tried to invade the Undying Lands.

name: Effexor
explanation: Effexor (venlafaxine) is an SNRI antidepressant used for depression and anxiety disorders.

name: Grafana
explanation: Grafana is an open-source analytics and visualization platform for monitoring data.

name: Mewtwo
explanation: Mewtwo is a Psychic-type legendary Pokémon created through genetic engineering from Mew's DNA.

name: Ditto
explanation: Ditto is a Normal-type Pokémon that can transform into anything, and also a clipboard manager app for macOS.

name: Porygon
explanation: Porygon is the first artificial Pokémon, made entirely of programming code - a literal programming construct.

name: Polygon
explanation: Polygon is a Layer 2 blockchain, and also a fundamental term in computer graphics for shapes made of vertices.

name: Celexa
explanation: Celexa (citalopram) is an SSRI antidepressant used for depression.

name: Chansey
explanation: Chansey is a Normal-type Pokémon that carries a healing egg in its pouch.

name: Blissey
explanation: Blissey is Chansey's evolution, known for its nurturing nature and high HP.

name: Drowzee
explanation: Drowzee is a Psychic-type Pokémon that feeds on dreams.

name: Hypno
explanation: Hypno is Drowzee's evolution, carrying a pendulum it uses to hypnotize prey.

name: Electrode
explanation: Electrode is an Electric-type Pokémon that resembles a Poké Ball and is known for exploding.

name: Magneton
explanation: Magneton is an Electric/Steel-type Pokémon composed of three Magnemite linked together.

name: Rotom
explanation: Rotom is an Electric/Ghost-type Pokémon that can possess electrical appliances.

name: Heroku
explanation: Heroku is a cloud platform as a service (PaaS) for deploying and managing applications.

name: Roku
explanation: Roku is a streaming device and platform company founded in 2002.

name: Redis
explanation: Redis is an in-memory data structure store used as a database, cache, and message broker.

name: Istio
explanation: Istio is an open-source service mesh for Kubernetes that manages microservice traffic.

name: Paxil
explanation: Paxil (paroxetine) is an SSRI antidepressant used for depression and anxiety disorders.

name: Pristiq
explanation: Pristiq (desvenlafaxine) is an SNRI antidepressant, the active metabolite of Effexor.

name: Remeron
explanation: Remeron (mirtazapine) is a tetracyclic antidepressant that also helps with sleep.

name: Trintellix
explanation: Trintellix (vortioxetine) is an antidepressant with a multimodal mechanism of action.

name: Trazodone
explanation: Trazodone is an antidepressant often prescribed off-label for insomnia.

name: Abilify
explanation: Abilify (aripiprazole) is an atypical antipsychotic used to augment antidepressant treatment.

name: Sauron
explanation: Sauron is the Dark Lord, creator of the One Ring, and main antagonist of Lord of the Rings.

name: Saruman
explanation: Saruman the White was the head of the wizard order who was corrupted by Sauron.

name: Legolas
explanation: Legolas is the Elven prince of Mirkwood and member of the Fellowship, known for his archery.

name: Gimli
explanation: Gimli is the Dwarf warrior of the Fellowship, son of Glóin, and friend of Legolas.

name: Elrond
explanation: Elrond Half-elven is the Lord of Rivendell who hosted the Council that formed the Fellowship.

name: Balrog
explanation: The Balrog is an ancient demon of shadow and flame that Gandalf faced in Moria.

name: Nazgûl
explanation: The Nazgûl are the nine Ringwraiths in LOTR, and also an Italian black metal band formed in 1992.

name: Glamdring
explanation: Glamdring is Gandalf's Elven sword, also known as 'Foe-hammer', found in a troll hoard.

name: Morgoth
explanation: Morgoth was the first Dark Lord in Tolkien's legendarium, and also a German death metal band formed in 1985.

name: Shelob
explanation: Shelob is the giant spider who guards the pass of Cirith Ungol and attacked Frodo.

name: Prometheus
explanation: Prometheus is a Greek Titan who gave fire to humanity, and also an open-source monitoring system.

name: Loki
explanation: Loki is the Norse trickster god, and also a log aggregation system by Grafana Labs.

name: Helm
explanation: Helm is a package manager for Kubernetes that uses chart templates.

name: Vault
explanation: HashiCorp Vault is a secrets management tool for storing and accessing sensitive data.

name: Consul
explanation: HashiCorp Consul is a service mesh solution for service discovery and configuration.

name: Nomad
explanation: HashiCorp Nomad is a workload orchestrator for deploying and managing applications.

name: Envoy
explanation: Envoy is a high-performance proxy designed for service mesh architectures.

name: Arceus
explanation: Arceus is the mythical 'God Pokémon' said to have created the Pokémon universe.

name: Dialga
explanation: Dialga is a Steel/Dragon-type legendary Pokémon that controls time.

name: Palkia
explanation: Palkia is a Water/Dragon-type legendary Pokémon that controls space.

name: Giratina
explanation: Giratina is a Ghost/Dragon-type legendary Pokémon that rules the Distortion World.

name: Luxray
explanation: Luxray is an Electric-type Pokémon with eyes that can see through anything.

name: Lucario
explanation: Lucario is a Fighting/Steel-type Pokémon that can sense and manipulate aura.

name: Audino
explanation: Audino is a Normal-type Pokémon that can sense feelings through its ear feelers.

name: Latios
explanation: Latios is a Dragon/Psychic-type legendary Pokémon known for high intelligence.

name: Latias
explanation: Latias is a Dragon/Psychic-type legendary Pokémon and Latios's counterpart.

name: Solana
explanation: Solana is a high-performance blockchain platform known for fast transaction speeds.

name: Avalanche
explanation: Avalanche is a blockchain platform for decentralized applications and custom networks.

name: Cardano
explanation: Cardano is a proof-of-stake blockchain platform named after mathematician Gerolamo Cardano.

name: Ansible
explanation: Ansible is an IT automation tool for configuration management and application deployment.

name: Datadog
explanation: Datadog is a monitoring and analytics platform for cloud-scale applications.

name: Splunk
explanation: Splunk is a platform for searching, monitoring, and analyzing machine-generated data.

name: Supabase
explanation: Supabase is an open-source Firebase alternative with a PostgreSQL database.

name: Vercel
explanation: Vercel is a cloud platform for frontend deployment, created by the makers of Next.js.

name: Netlify
explanation: Netlify is a web development platform for building and deploying modern web projects.

name: Eowyn
explanation: Éowyn is the shieldmaiden of Rohan who slew the Witch-king of Angmar.

name: Faramir
explanation: Faramir is Boromir's brother and Captain of Gondor who helped Frodo on his quest.

name: Boromir
explanation: Boromir is the son of Denethor who was corrupted by the Ring but redeemed himself in death.

name: Isildur
explanation: Isildur cut the Ring from Sauron's hand but refused to destroy it.

name: Treebeard
explanation: Treebeard (Fangorn) is the oldest Ent who led the attack on Isengard.

name: Smeagol
explanation: Sméagol was a Hobbit-like creature corrupted into Gollum by the One Ring.

name: Slowpoke
explanation: Slowpoke is a Water/Psychic-type Pokémon known for its slow reactions.

name: Abra
explanation: Abra is a Psychic-type Pokémon that sleeps 18 hours a day and teleports when threatened.

name: Kadabra
explanation: Kadabra is Abra's evolution, a Psychic-type that emits alpha waves from its body.

name: Alakazam
explanation: Alakazam is Kadabra's evolution with an IQ of 5,000 and powerful psychic abilities.

name: Nidoran
explanation: Nidoran is a Poison-type Pokémon that was the first to have distinct male and female forms.

name: Gengar
explanation: Gengar is a Ghost/Poison-type Pokémon that hides in shadows to steal heat from surroundings.

name: Arcanine
explanation: Arcanine is a Fire-type Pokémon known for its speed, loyalty, and majestic appearance.

name: Arduino
explanation: Arduino is an open-source electronics platform with easy-to-use hardware and software.

name: Nginx
explanation: Nginx is a popular web server, reverse proxy, and load balancer.

name: Traefik
explanation: Traefik is a modern reverse proxy and load balancer for microservices.

name: Cilium
explanation: Cilium is eBPF-based networking and security for Kubernetes and other platforms.

name: Falco
explanation: Falco is a cloud-native runtime security tool for detecting threats in containers.

name: Argo
explanation: Argo is a collection of Kubernetes-native tools for workflows, deployments, and GitOps.

name: Seroquel
explanation: Seroquel (quetiapine) is an atypical antipsychotic used for bipolar disorder and depression.

name: Latuda
explanation: Latuda (lurasidone) is an atypical antipsychotic used for bipolar depression and schizophrenia.

name: Vraylar
explanation: Vraylar (cariprazine) is an atypical antipsychotic for bipolar disorder and schizophrenia.

name: Rexulti
explanation: Rexulti (brexpiprazole) is an atypical antipsychotic used to augment antidepressant treatment.

name: Viibryd
explanation: Viibryd (vilazodone) is an SSRI antidepressant with partial 5-HT1A agonist activity.

name: Gastly
explanation: Gastly is a Ghost/Poison-type Pokémon composed almost entirely of gas.

name: Koffing
explanation: Koffing is a Poison-type Pokémon that stores toxic gases in its body.

name: Weezing
explanation: Weezing is Koffing's evolution, consisting of two Koffing fused together.

name: Tangela
explanation: Tangela is a Grass-type Pokémon whose body is covered in thick blue vines.

name: Nidoking
explanation: Nidoking is the final evolution of male Nidoran, a powerful Poison/Ground-type.

name: Starmie
explanation: Starmie is a Water/Psychic-type starfish Pokémon with a glowing jewel core.

name: Dratini
explanation: Dratini is a Dragon-type Pokémon that was long considered a mythical creature.

name: Dragonite
explanation: Dragonite is Dratini's final evolution, a Dragon/Flying-type known for rescuing people at sea.

name: Orcrist
explanation: Orcrist is Thorin Oakenshield's Elven sword, known as the 'Goblin-cleaver'.

name: Narsil
explanation: Narsil was the sword that cut the Ring from Sauron's hand, later reforged as Andúril.

name: Lothlórien
explanation: Lothlórien is the golden forest realm ruled by Galadriel and Celeborn.

name: Rivendell
explanation: Rivendell (Imladris) is Elrond's hidden valley sanctuary in the Misty Mountains.

name: Mirkwood
explanation: Mirkwood is the great forest home to Wood-elves, corrupted by Sauron's influence.

name: Mordor
explanation: Mordor is Sauron's realm of shadow where Mount Doom lies and the Ring was forged.

name: Kibana
explanation: Kibana is a data visualization dashboard for Elasticsearch.

name: Elasticsearch
explanation: Elasticsearch is a distributed search and analytics engine.

name: Pulumi
explanation: Pulumi is an infrastructure-as-code tool supporting multiple programming languages.

name: Celeborn
explanation: Celeborn is Galadriel's husband and Lord of Lothlórien.

name: Thranduil
explanation: Thranduil is Legolas's father and King of the Woodland Realm in Mirkwood.

name: Denethor
explanation: Denethor II was the Steward of Gondor who went mad from using a palantír.

name: Glorfindel
explanation: Glorfindel is a mighty Elf-lord who helped Frodo escape the Nazgûl to Rivendell.

name: Théoden
explanation: Théoden was the King of Rohan who led the charge at Pelennor Fields.

name: Éomer
explanation: Éomer is Éowyn's brother and Marshal of the Riddermark who became King of Rohan.

name: Odin
explanation: Odin is the Norse Allfather, god of wisdom, war, and death who sacrificed an eye for knowledge.

name: Thor
explanation: Thor is the Norse god of thunder who wields the hammer Mjölnir.

name: Freya
explanation: Freya is the Norse goddess of love, beauty, and war who rides a chariot pulled by cats.

name: Tyr
explanation: Týr is the Norse god of war who lost his hand to Fenrir, and also a Faroese folk metal band.

name: Baldur
explanation: Baldur is the Norse god of light and purity, killed by mistletoe due to Loki's trickery.

name: Heimdall
explanation: Heimdall is the Norse guardian of Bifröst who can see and hear across all realms.

name: Frigg
explanation: Frigg is Odin's wife and the Norse goddess of marriage and motherhood.

name: Hel
explanation: Hel is the Norse goddess of the underworld, daughter of Loki, half alive and half dead.

name: Fenrir
explanation: Fenrir is the monstrous Norse wolf destined to kill Odin at Ragnarök, and also multiple metal bands.

name: Zeus
explanation: Zeus is the Greek king of the gods, ruler of Mount Olympus and god of thunder.

name: Apollo
explanation: Apollo is the Greek god of sun, music, and prophecy, and also a GraphQL API platform.

name: Athena
explanation: Athena is the Greek goddess of wisdom and warfare, born from Zeus's head.

name: Poseidon
explanation: Poseidon is the Greek god of the sea, earthquakes, and horses.

name: Hades
explanation: Hades is the Greek god of the underworld and ruler of the dead.

name: Ares
explanation: Ares is the Greek god of war, known for his brutal and violent nature.

name: Hermes
explanation: Hermes is the Greek messenger god, also patron of thieves, travelers, and commerce.

name: Artemis
explanation: Artemis is the Greek goddess of the hunt, wilderness, and the moon.

name: Aphrodite
explanation: Aphrodite is the Greek goddess of love and beauty, born from sea foam.

name: Dionysus
explanation: Dionysus is the Greek god of wine, festivity, and religious ecstasy.

name: Atlas
explanation: Atlas is the Greek Titan condemned to hold up the sky, and also MongoDB's cloud database platform.

name: Cassandra
explanation: Cassandra was a Greek prophetess cursed to never be believed, and also an Apache distributed database.

name: Pandora
explanation: Pandora opened the box releasing evils into the world, and is also a music streaming service.

name: Jupiter
explanation: Jupiter is the Roman king of the gods, equivalent to the Greek Zeus.

name: Mars
explanation: Mars is the Roman god of war, more honored than his Greek counterpart Ares.

name: Venus
explanation: Venus is the Roman goddess of love, equivalent to the Greek Aphrodite.

name: Neptune
explanation: Neptune is the Roman god of the sea, equivalent to the Greek Poseidon.

name: Mercury
explanation: Mercury is the Roman messenger god, equivalent to the Greek Hermes.

name: Vulcan
explanation: Vulcan is the Roman god of fire and the forge, equivalent to the Greek Hephaestus.

name: Minerva
explanation: Minerva is the Roman goddess of wisdom, equivalent to the Greek Athena.

name: Juno
explanation: Juno is the Roman queen of the gods, and also an email security company.

name: Ceres
explanation: Ceres is the Roman goddess of agriculture and harvest.

name: Pluto
explanation: Pluto is the Roman god of the underworld, equivalent to the Greek Hades.

name: Morrigan
explanation: The Morrígan is the Celtic goddess of war, fate, and death, often appearing as a crow.

name: Brigid
explanation: Brigid is the Celtic goddess of fire, poetry, and smithcraft.

name: Cernunnos
explanation: Cernunnos is the Celtic horned god of nature, animals, and fertility.

name: Danu
explanation: Danu is the Celtic mother goddess, ancestor of the Tuatha Dé Danann.

name: Lugh
explanation: Lugh is the Celtic god of skill, crafts, and many talents.

name: Dagda
explanation: The Dagda is the Celtic father god with a magic club and cauldron of plenty.

name: Epona
explanation: Epona is the Celtic goddess of horses, later adopted into Roman worship.

name: Mastodon
explanation: Mastodon is an American progressive metal band, and also a decentralized social media platform.

name: Gojira
explanation: Gojira is a French progressive/death metal band named after the Japanese name for Godzilla.

name: Opeth
explanation: Opeth is a Swedish progressive metal/rock band known for blending death metal with acoustic passages.

name: Meshuggah
explanation: Meshuggah is a Swedish extreme metal band known for polyrhythmic compositions. The name is Yiddish for 'crazy'.

name: Amon Amarth
explanation: Amon Amarth is a Swedish melodic death metal band named after Mount Doom's Sindarin name in LOTR.

name: Gorgoroth
explanation: Gorgoroth is a Norwegian black metal band named after the plateau in Mordor from LOTR.

name: Burzum
explanation: Burzum was a Norwegian black metal project. The name is Black Speech for 'darkness' from LOTR.

name: Venom
explanation: Venom is an English extreme metal band and pioneers of the black metal genre.

name: Behemoth
explanation: Behemoth is a Polish death metal band, a biblical monster, and a creature type in D&D.

name: Nile
explanation: Nile is an American death metal band known for Egyptian and ancient themes.

name: Carcass
explanation: Carcass is an English extreme metal band and pioneers of grindcore and melodic death metal.

name: Sepultura
explanation: Sepultura is a Brazilian metal band. The name is Portuguese for 'grave'.

name: Testament
explanation: Testament is an American thrash metal band from the San Francisco Bay Area.

name: Exodus
explanation: Exodus is an American thrash metal band and one of the originators of Bay Area thrash.

name: Overkill
explanation: Overkill is an American thrash metal band from New Jersey, active since 1980.

name: Death
explanation: Death was an American band led by Chuck Schuldiner, pioneers of the death metal genre.

name: Emperor
explanation: Emperor was a Norwegian black metal band known for symphonic elements.

name: Immortal
explanation: Immortal is a Norwegian black metal band known for their 'Blashyrkh' mythology.

name: Mayhem
explanation: Mayhem is a Norwegian black metal band influential in the second wave of black metal.

name: Nightwish
explanation: Nightwish is a Finnish symphonic metal band known for operatic vocals and orchestral arrangements.

name: Epica
explanation: Epica is a Dutch symphonic metal band featuring operatic female vocals and orchestral elements.

name: Kamelot
explanation: Kamelot is an American power metal band named after the legendary castle of King Arthur.

name: Sabaton
explanation: Sabaton is a Swedish power metal band focused on historical wars. Named after armored boots.

name: Eluveitie
explanation: Eluveitie is a Swiss folk metal band blending melodic death metal with Celtic folk instruments.

name: Ensiferum
explanation: Ensiferum is a Finnish folk metal band. The name is Latin for 'sword-bearer'.

name: Rammstein
explanation: Rammstein is a German industrial metal band known for German lyrics and pyrotechnic live shows.

name: Trivium
explanation: Trivium is an American heavy metal band. Named after the classical education trivium.

name: Baroness
explanation: Baroness is an American heavy metal band known for progressive elements and colorful artwork.

name: Sleep
explanation: Sleep is an American stoner/doom metal band known for extremely long songs.

name: Ghost
explanation: Ghost is a Swedish rock/metal band known for Satanic imagery and melodic hooks.

name: Slayer
explanation: Slayer was an American thrash metal band, one of the 'Big Four' of thrash metal.

name: Anthrax
explanation: Anthrax is an American thrash metal band, one of the 'Big Four' of thrash metal.

name: Kreator
explanation: Kreator is a German thrash metal band, one of the 'Big Teutonic Four'.

name: Darkthrone
explanation: Darkthrone is a Norwegian black metal band influential in the second wave of black metal.

name: Dimmu Borgir
explanation: Dimmu Borgir is a Norwegian symphonic black metal band named after an Icelandic lava formation.

name: Arch Enemy
explanation: Arch Enemy is a Swedish melodic death metal band known for technical guitar work.

name: Amorphis
explanation: Amorphis is a Finnish metal band blending progressive, folk, and death metal elements.

name: Insomnium
explanation: Insomnium is a Finnish melodic death metal band known for melancholic atmospheres.

name: Kallax
explanation: KALLAX is IKEA's popular cube shelving unit system.

name: Malm
explanation: MALM is IKEA's bed and dresser series. The name is Swedish for 'ore'.

name: Billy
explanation: BILLY is IKEA's iconic bookcase, in production since 1979.

name: Poäng
explanation: POÄNG is IKEA's bentwood armchair. The name is Swedish for 'point'.

name: Lack
explanation: LACK is IKEA's affordable side table series with a hollow core design.

name: Hemnes
explanation: HEMNES is IKEA's traditional furniture series named after a Norwegian municipality.

name: Bestå
explanation: BESTÅ is IKEA's modular storage system. The name means 'to consist' in Swedish.

name: Detolf
explanation: DETOLF is IKEA's glass-door display cabinet.

name: Ektorp
explanation: EKTORP is IKEA's classic sofa series with removable, washable covers.

name: Klippan
explanation: KLIPPAN is IKEA's compact loveseat named after a Swedish town.

name: Frakta
explanation: FRAKTA is IKEA's iconic blue shopping bag. Swedish for 'to transport'.

name: Björkudden
explanation: BJÖRKUDDEN is an IKEA table series. Swedish for 'birch point'.

name: Råskog
explanation: RÅSKOG is IKEA's steel utility cart on casters.

name: Bekväm
explanation: BEKVÄM is IKEA's wooden step stool. Swedish for 'comfortable'.

name: Strandmon
explanation: STRANDMON is IKEA's wing chair inspired by a 1950s Scandinavian design.

name: Järvfjället
explanation: JÄRVFJÄLLET is IKEA's ergonomic office chair. Swedish for 'mountain of Järv'.

name: Markus
explanation: MARKUS is IKEA's popular ergonomic office chair with a high back.

name: Kivik
explanation: KIVIK is IKEA's deep-seated sofa series named after a Swedish town.

name: Söderhamn
explanation: SÖDERHAMN is IKEA's modular sofa system named after a Swedish city.

name: Vittsjö
explanation: VITTSJÖ is IKEA's glass and metal shelving unit. Swedish for 'white lake'.

name: Havsta
explanation: HAVSTA is IKEA's solid pine storage furniture series.

name: Ivar
explanation: IVAR is IKEA's untreated pine shelving system designed for customization.

name: Trofast
explanation: TROFAST is IKEA's children's storage system with bins. Swedish for 'faithful'.

name: Brimnes
explanation: BRIMNES is IKEA's bedroom furniture series with built-in storage.

name: Nordli
explanation: NORDLI is IKEA's modular bedroom furniture series.

name: Fenomen
explanation: FENOMEN is IKEA's unscented block candle. Swedish for 'phenomenon'.

name: Skurup
explanation: SKURUP is IKEA's pendant and floor lamp series named after a Swedish town.

name: Tertial
explanation: TERTIAL is IKEA's adjustable work lamp with an articulated arm.

name: Godmorgon
explanation: GODMORGON is IKEA's bathroom furniture series. Swedish for 'good morning'.

name: Flisat
explanation: FLISAT is IKEA's children's furniture series made from solid pine.

name: Antilop
explanation: ANTILOP is IKEA's high chair for babies. Swedish for 'antelope'.

name: Duktig
explanation: DUKTIG is IKEA's children's play kitchen series. Swedish for 'clever' or 'good'.

name: Anakin
explanation: Anakin Skywalker is the Chosen One who became Darth Vader.

name: Padmé
explanation: Padmé Amidala is the Queen and Senator of Naboo, mother of Luke and Leia.

name: Qui-Gon
explanation: Qui-Gon Jinn is the Jedi Master who discovered Anakin Skywalker on Tatooine.

name: Obi-Wan
explanation: Obi-Wan Kenobi is the legendary Jedi Master who trained both Anakin and Luke Skywalker.

name: Yoda
explanation: Yoda is the 900-year-old Jedi Grand Master known for his wisdom and unique speech pattern.

name: Mace Windu
explanation: Mace Windu is a Jedi Master and member of the Jedi Council who wields a purple lightsaber.

name: Palpatine
explanation: Palpatine is the Sith Lord Darth Sidious who manipulated his way to becoming Emperor.

name: Dooku
explanation: Count Dooku is a former Jedi who became the Sith Lord Darth Tyranus.

name: Grievous
explanation: General Grievous is the cyborg Supreme Commander of the Separatist Droid Army.

name: Kylo Ren
explanation: Kylo Ren is Ben Solo's dark side identity, grandson of Darth Vader.

name: Ahsoka
explanation: Ahsoka Tano is a Togruta former Jedi Padawan of Anakin Skywalker.

name: Grogu
explanation: Grogu is a Force-sensitive youngling of Yoda's species, found by Din Djarin.

name: Din Djarin
explanation: Din Djarin is a Mandalorian bounty hunter who becomes Grogu's guardian.

name: Thrawn
explanation: Grand Admiral Thrawn is a Chiss tactical genius serving the Galactic Empire.

name: Tarkin
explanation: Grand Moff Tarkin is the Imperial officer who commanded the first Death Star.

name: Jabba
explanation: Jabba the Hutt is a powerful crime lord operating from Tatooine.

name: Boba Fett
explanation: Boba Fett is a legendary bounty hunter and unaltered clone of Jango Fett.

name: Chewbacca
explanation: Chewbacca is a Wookiee warrior and Han Solo's co-pilot and best friend.

name: Lando
explanation: Lando Calrissian is a gambler, smuggler, and former Baron Administrator of Cloud City.

name: Tatooine
explanation: Tatooine is the desert planet with twin suns where Luke Skywalker was raised.

name: Coruscant
explanation: Coruscant is the city-covered planet that served as capital of the Republic and Empire.

name: Naboo
explanation: Naboo is a lush planet home to humans and the amphibious Gungans.

name: Mustafar
explanation: Mustafar is a volcanic planet where Anakin Skywalker was defeated and became Vader.

name: Hoth
explanation: Hoth is the frozen ice planet where the Rebel Alliance established Echo Base.

name: Dagobah
explanation: Dagobah is the swamp planet where Yoda lived in exile and trained Luke.

name: Endor
explanation: Endor is the forest moon inhabited by Ewoks where the second Death Star was destroyed.

name: Bespin
explanation: Bespin is the gas giant planet where Cloud City floats in the atmosphere.

name: Kashyyyk
explanation: Kashyyyk is the forested homeworld of the Wookiees.

name: Mandalore
explanation: Mandalore is the homeworld of the Mandalorian warrior culture.

name: Alderaan
explanation: Alderaan was Princess Leia's peaceful homeworld, destroyed by the Death Star.

name: Jakku
explanation: Jakku is the desert junkyard planet where Rey grew up scavenging.

name: Kyber
explanation: Kyber crystals are Force-attuned crystals that power lightsabers.

name: Holocron
explanation: Holocrons are ancient data storage devices containing Jedi or Sith knowledge.

name: Bacta
explanation: Bacta is a healing substance used in medical tanks to treat injuries.

name: Sarlacc
explanation: The Sarlacc is a large omnivorous creature that digests prey over thousands of years.

name: Rancor
explanation: Rancors are large predatory reptiles, one was kept as a pet by Jabba the Hutt.

name: Ewok
explanation: Ewoks are small furry sentient beings native to the forest moon of Endor.

name: Wookiee
explanation: Wookiees are tall, hairy sentient beings from Kashyyyk known for strength and loyalty.

name: Twi'lek
explanation: Twi'leks are a humanoid species with distinctive head-tails called lekku.

name: Zabrak
explanation: Zabraks are a humanoid species with vestigial horns, including Darth Maul.

name: Sith
explanation: The Sith are an order of Force users who embrace the dark side.

name: Jedi
explanation: The Jedi are an order of Force users who serve as peacekeepers of the galaxy.

name: Cirith Ungol
explanation: Cirith Ungol is the spider pass into Mordor guarded by Shelob, and also a classic American heavy metal band formed in 1972.

name: Isengard
explanation: Isengard is Saruman's fortress in LOTR, and also a Norwegian black metal project by Fenriz of Darkthrone.

name: Carach Angren
explanation: Carach Angren is Sindarin for 'Iron Jaws', a location in Mordor, and also a Dutch symphonic black metal band.

name: Marduk
explanation: Marduk is the chief Babylonian deity, and also a legendary Swedish black metal band formed in 1990.

name: Daedalus
explanation: Daedalus is the Greek mythological master craftsman and father of Icarus, and also the official Cardano cryptocurrency wallet.

name: Triton
explanation: Triton is the Greek merman god (son of Poseidon), NVIDIA's GPU programming language, and a playable aquatic race in D&D.

name: Medusa
explanation: Medusa is the Greek Gorgon with snake hair, an open-source commerce platform, and a classic D&D monster type.

name: Cerberus
explanation: Cerberus is the three-headed dog of Greek myth, an Android security app, and appears in D&D's Nine Hells.

name: Hyperion
explanation: Hyperion is the Greek Titan of light, and also an Apache Big Data platform and SAP's OLAP database.

name: Chronos
explanation: Chronos is the Greek personification of Time, and also a distributed cron job scheduler by Airbnb.

name: Morpheus
explanation: Morpheus is the Greek god of dreams, and also NVIDIA's cybersecurity AI framework.

name: Talos
explanation: Talos is the Greek mythological bronze automaton protecting Crete, and also Cisco's threat intelligence organization.

name: Helios
explanation: Helios is the Greek god of the Sun, and also LinkedIn's open-source search platform.

name: Hera
explanation: Hera is the Greek queen of the gods, and also a workflow orchestration SDK for Argo Workflows.

name: Kraken
explanation: The Kraken is a legendary Norse sea monster, a major crypto exchange, and a powerful D&D monster.

name: Icarus
explanation: Icarus is the Greek figure who flew too close to the sun, and also Icarus Verilog, a hardware simulation tool.

name: Titan
explanation: The Titans are primordial Greek gods, Google's TPU security chip, and powerful beings in D&D (Empyreans).

name: Sleipnir
explanation: Sleipnir is Odin's eight-legged horse in Norse mythology, and also a Japanese web browser.

name: Tesseract
explanation: TesseracT is a British metal band, a 4D hypercube in math, and Google's open-source OCR programming library.

name: Xentrix
explanation: Xentrix is a British thrash metal band formed in 1985.

name: Skorupi
explanation: Skorupi is a Poison/Bug-type Pokémon that looks like a scorpion.

name: Klefki
explanation: Klefki is a Steel/Fairy-type Pokémon that collects keys on its ring-shaped body.

name: Xerneas
explanation: Xerneas is the Fairy-type legendary Pokémon representing life in Pokémon X.

name: Geodon
explanation: Geodon (ziprasidone) is an atypical antipsychotic used for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

name: Lunesta
explanation: Lunesta (eszopiclone) is a sedative-hypnotic medication prescribed for insomnia.

name: Zyprexa
explanation: Zyprexa (olanzapine) is an atypical antipsychotic used for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

name: Klonopin
explanation: Klonopin (clonazepam) is a benzodiazepine used for anxiety and seizure disorders.

name: Thorazine
explanation: Thorazine (chlorpromazine) was the first major antipsychotic medication, approved in 1954.

name: Risperdal
explanation: Risperdal (risperidone) is an atypical antipsychotic used for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

name: Nardil
explanation: Nardil (phenelzine) is an MAOI antidepressant requiring dietary restrictions.

name: Lamictal
explanation: Lamictal (lamotrigine) is a mood stabilizer used for bipolar disorder and epilepsy.

name: Invega
explanation: Invega (paliperidone) is an extended-release atypical antipsychotic for schizophrenia.

name: Skogsta
explanation: Skogsta is IKEA's solid acacia wood dining furniture series.

name: Vallentuna
explanation: Vallentuna is IKEA's modular seating system named after a Swedish municipality.

name: Kura
explanation: Kura is IKEA's reversible children's bed that can be flipped for different heights.

name: Norden
explanation: Norden is IKEA's gateleg table with drawers. Swedish for 'the North'.

name: Friheten
explanation: Friheten is IKEA's sofa bed with storage. Swedish for 'freedom'.

name: Bossk
explanation: Bossk is a Trandoshan bounty hunter who appears in The Empire Strikes Back.

name: Lobot
explanation: Lobot is Lando Calrissian's cyborg aide with a computer headband in Cloud City.

name: Ventress
explanation: Asajj Ventress is a Dathomirian dark side assassin from the Clone Wars series.

name: Sebulba
explanation: Sebulba is the Dug podracer who cheated against young Anakin in The Phantom Menace.

name: Plo Koon
explanation: Plo Koon is a Kel Dor Jedi Master and member of the Jedi Council.

name: Gonk
explanation: Gonk droids (GNK Power Droids) are walking battery units that make 'gonk' sounds.

name: Dengar
explanation: Dengar is a human bounty hunter seen on Vader's Star Destroyer in The Empire Strikes Back.

name: Lambda
explanation: Lambda is a Greek letter, a core concept in functional programming, and AWS Lambda is a serverless computing service.

name: Redux
explanation: Redux is a JavaScript state management library commonly used with React.

name: Kotlin
explanation: Kotlin is a modern programming language for Android development, created by JetBrains.

name: Scala
explanation: Scala is a functional programming language that runs on the JVM.

name: Haskell
explanation: Haskell is a purely functional programming language named after logician Haskell Curry.

name: Clojure
explanation: Clojure is a functional Lisp dialect that runs on the JVM.

name: Tuple
explanation: A tuple is an immutable ordered collection of elements, used in many programming languages.

name: Vector
explanation: A vector is a dynamic array data structure and a fundamental concept in graphics programming.

name: Pixilate
explanation: Pixilate is a Pokémon ability that turns Normal-type moves into Fairy-type moves.

name: Saruhan
explanation: Saruhan was an Anatolian beylik (Turkish principality) in western Anatolia during the 14th-15th centuries.

name: Aragon
explanation: Aragon was a medieval Spanish kingdom that united with Castile to form modern Spain.

name: Gondar
explanation: Gondar is an Ethiopian city that served as the capital of the Ethiopian Empire from 1636 to 1855.

name: Trebizond
explanation: The Empire of Trebizond was a Byzantine successor state on the Black Sea coast, lasting from 1204 to 1461.

name: Wallachia
explanation: Wallachia was a Romanian principality and home of Vlad the Impaler (Dracula).

name: Byzantium
explanation: Byzantium was the Eastern Roman Empire, lasting from 330 AD until Constantinople fell in 1453.

name: Khmer
explanation: The Khmer Empire was a powerful Southeast Asian state that built Angkor Wat, lasting from 802 to 1431.

name: Ayutthaya
explanation: Ayutthaya was a Thai kingdom that preceded modern Thailand, flourishing from 1351 to 1767.

name: Majapahit
explanation: Majapahit was a powerful Indonesian maritime empire based in Java from 1293 to around 1527.

name: Vijayanagar
explanation: Vijayanagar was a powerful South Indian empire that ruled much of southern India from 1336 to 1646.

name: Theodoro
explanation: Theodoro was a small Gothic principality in Crimea that existed from the 13th century until 1475.

name: Ulm
explanation: Ulm is a German city on the Danube, birthplace of Albert Einstein and home to the world's tallest church steeple.

name: Dithmarschen
explanation: Dithmarschen was a medieval peasant republic in northern Germany that defeated Danish armies in 1500.

name: Mewar
explanation: Mewar was a Rajput kingdom in India famous for resisting Mughal conquest under Maharana Pratap.

name: Ternate
explanation: Ternate was a sultanate in the Indonesian Spice Islands, a major clove producer and trading power.

name: Tidore
explanation: Tidore was Ternate's rival sultanate in the Spice Islands, allied with Spain against Portuguese-backed Ternate.

name: Tiamat
explanation: Tiamat is the Babylonian goddess of primordial chaos, and also the five-headed dragon goddess of evil in D&D.

name: Bahamut
explanation: Bahamut is a fish from Arabian mythology supporting the world, and also the platinum dragon god of good in D&D.

name: Asmodeus
explanation: Asmodeus is a demon king from Jewish and Christian demonology, and also the archdevil ruler of the Nine Hells in D&D.

name: Balduran
explanation: Balduran was a legendary explorer and founder of the city of Baldur's Gate in the Forgotten Realms.

name: Tarrasque
explanation: The Tarrasque is a legendary dinosaur-like monstrosity in D&D, considered nearly impossible to kill.

name: Mystra
explanation: Mystra is the goddess of magic in the Forgotten Realms, keeper of the Weave.

name: Vecna
explanation: Vecna is a powerful lich who became a god, known for his Hand and Eye artifacts in D&D.

name: Beholder
explanation: A Beholder is an iconic D&D monster - a floating orb with a central eye and eyestalks with magical rays.

name: Illithid
explanation: Illithids (Mind Flayers) are psionic aberrations with tentacled faces that consume brains in D&D.

name: Drow
explanation: The Drow are dark elves who live in the Underdark, known for their worship of Lolth in D&D.

name: Lich
explanation: A Lich is an undead spellcaster who achieved immortality by binding their soul to a phylactery in D&D.

name: Strahd
explanation: Count Strahd von Zarovich is the vampire lord of Barovia in the classic D&D adventure Curse of Strahd.

name: Mordenkainen
explanation: Mordenkainen is a legendary archmage from Greyhawk, namesake of many D&D spells like Mordenkainen's Sword.

name: Elminster
explanation: Elminster Aumar is the Sage of Shadowdale, one of the most powerful wizards in the Forgotten Realms.

name: Acererak
explanation: Acererak is a powerful demilich, creator of the Tomb of Horrors and Tomb of Annihilation dungeons.

name: Faerûn
explanation: Faerûn is the main continent of the Forgotten Realms campaign setting in D&D.

name: Netheril
explanation: Netheril was an ancient magical empire with flying cities in the Forgotten Realms.

name: Thay
explanation: Thay is a magocracy ruled by the Red Wizards in the Forgotten Realms.

name: Lolth
explanation: Lolth is the spider goddess of the Drow, also known as the Queen of the Demonweb Pits.

name: Drizzt
explanation: Drizzt Do'Urden is a famous Drow ranger who rejected his evil heritage, wielding twin scimitars.

name: Underdark
explanation: The Underdark is a vast subterranean realm beneath Faerûn, home to Drow, Duergar, and Illithids.

name: Flumph
explanation: A Flumph is a friendly floating aberration that feeds on psionic energy - one of D&D's quirkiest monsters.

name: Gelatinous Cube
explanation: A Gelatinous Cube is a transparent ooze that fills dungeon corridors, dissolving anything it engulfs.

name: Owlbear
explanation: An Owlbear is an iconic D&D monster combining an owl's head with a bear's body.

name: Displacer Beast
explanation: A Displacer Beast is a six-legged panther-like creature with tentacles that projects illusions of itself.

name: Githyanki
explanation: The Githyanki are a warrior race from the Astral Plane who ride red dragons and hunt Illithids.

name: Githzerai
explanation: The Githzerai are psionic monks living in Limbo, cousins and enemies of the Githyanki.

name: Aboleth
explanation: Aboleths are ancient aquatic aberrations with perfect memory that predate the gods in D&D lore.

name: Java
explanation: Java is a widely-used programming language, and also Indonesia's most populous island with rich history.

name: Mordva
explanation: Mordva (Mordovia) is a Russian region home to the Mordvin people, a Finno-Ugric ethnic group.

name: Kenku
explanation: Kenku are raven-like flightless bird people who can only speak by mimicking sounds in D&D.

name: Slaad
explanation: Slaadi are chaotic frog-like aberrations from the plane of Limbo in D&D.

name: Demogorgon
explanation: Demogorgon is the two-headed Prince of Demons, one of the most powerful demon lords in D&D.

name: Orcus
explanation: Orcus is the demon prince of undeath in D&D, named after the Roman god of the underworld.

name: Bulette
explanation: A Bulette is a shark-like burrowing monster in D&D, also called a 'landshark'.

name: Modron
explanation: Modrons are lawful clockwork beings from the plane of Mechanus in D&D.

name: Elixir
explanation: Elixir is a functional programming language that runs on the Erlang virtual machine.

name: Flutter
explanation: Flutter is Google's UI framework for building cross-platform mobile, web, and desktop apps.

name: Ember
explanation: Ember.js is a JavaScript framework for building ambitious web applications.

name: Morea
explanation: Morea was the medieval name for the Peloponnese peninsula in Greece, used from the 10th century onward.

name: Axum
explanation: Axum was a powerful Ethiopian kingdom (1st-7th century AD), considered one of the four great powers of the ancient world.

name: Lydia
explanation: Lydia was an ancient Anatolian kingdom famous for inventing coined money under King Croesus.

name: Nabataea
explanation: Nabataea was an ancient Arab kingdom centered at Petra (4th century BC - 106 AD), famous for rock-cut architecture.

name: Birka
explanation: Birka was a major Viking Age trading center in Sweden (8th-10th century), one of Scandinavia's earliest urban settlements.

name: Hedeby
explanation: Hedeby was a major Viking trading settlement in what is now northern Germany (8th-11th century).

name: Kush
explanation: Kush was an ancient Nubian kingdom in Sudan that once conquered Egypt, lasting from c. 1070 BC to 350 AD.

name: Elam
explanation: Elam was one of the oldest civilizations, located in ancient Iran, lasting from c. 3200 BC to 539 BC.

name: Pontus
explanation: Pontus was a Hellenistic kingdom on the Black Sea coast of Anatolia (281-63 BC), ruled by Mithridates the Great.

name: Colchis
explanation: Colchis was an ancient kingdom in the Caucasus (modern Georgia), famous in Greek myth as home of Medea and the Golden Fleece.

name: Urartu
explanation: Urartu was a powerful Iron Age kingdom in the Armenian Highlands (9th-6th century BC), a rival to Assyria.

name: Phrygia
explanation: Phrygia was an ancient Anatolian kingdom (12th-7th century BC), famous for King Midas and the Gordian Knot.
